history.content: Its a great class and is pretty easy to do. I had taken it when it was 100AC, and had just one essay, a final, and a midterm.  If you do the book readings (I didn't read any of the shorter essays lol) it's pretty much a guaranteed A, and luckily the readings are actually super interesting so yea, go for it!

children.subject:
Hey Rohit, any tips on how to do well on the mid quiz? Is it just

1. Lecture?

2. Book Readings for lecture and discussion?

and should I memorize things?

history.content:
It's also known as Hist 100AC and it's taught by Caitlin Rosenthal.

I'm taking my AC requirement this semester, and was highly recommended to take this course. However, i'm also taking 2 CS techs, and was hoping for a lighter load(I'll be P/NP the AC anyways).

Does anyone know the workload and if it's easy to pass? I already know it's apparently an amazing course, so I will probably stick with it.

What other chill AC courses would you recommend? I don't have too many options right now:

https://classes.berkeley.edu/search/class?page=1&f%5B0%5D=im_field_term_name%3A831&f%5B1%5D=ts_open_seats%3Aopen&f%5B2%5D=sm_general_requirement%3AAmerican%20Cultures
history.subject: History of American Capitalism, Hist133A?
